question: What would happen to global sea levels if all the ice in Antarctica melted?

steps.content: What would happen to global sea levels if all the ice in Antarctica melted?
Plan: 1) Search for scientific estimates of sea level rise if all Antarctic ice melted. 2) Return the answer.
Searching for the impact on global sea levels if all Antarctic ice melted.
If all the ice in Antarctica melted, global sea levels would rise by approximately 58 meters (190 feet).
If all the ice in Antarctica melted, global sea levels would rise by approximately 58 meters (190 feet), which would have catastrophic impacts on coastal cities and ecosystems worldwide.

true_answer: If all the ice in Antarctica melted, global sea levels would rise by approximately 58 meters (190 feet), which would have catastrophic impacts on coastal cities and ecosystems worldwide.
